link.title: Pi Program - News

form.name: aspnetForm

div.p: As ordered by Governor Inslee, all Chimacum Schools are closed through the end of the 2019-20 school year, June 19. All athletics, activities and clubs are cancelled during the school closure. This includes Head Start, Madrona, and West Sound Tech. Questions? Please call (360) 302-5891.

p.strong: Vision: Our schools strive to provide an exciting, flexible environment where students of all ages successfully prepare for their unique futures and as responsible members of society.

Mission: The Chimacum School District is committed to high academic expectations and standards. We proactively work together to provide skills, knowledge, and resources to ensure a fully supportive environment for excellence in education for the entire community.

a.title: Discrimination, Harassment, Intimidation, Bullying and Sexual Harrassment Reporting

li.a: Discrimination, Harassment, Intimidation, Bullying and Sexual Harrassment Reporting

p.span: Public Comment Period Closes at 4:00 pm May 8, 2020 with expected May 13, 2020 Board reading
Washington Office of Superintendent of Public Instruction has provided all districts with a document that outlines expectations and suggestions for Continuous Learning.
Here are five (5) things you need to know from the Chimacum School District ...

strong.span: To support our community during the school closure, Chimacum School District will hand out meals beginning Thursday, March 19th. Bus stop delivery starts Monday, March 23rd.

a.strong: Grab & Go Sack Meal Service Flyer

span.span: The Benji Project’s trained teachers host a FREE one-hour session two times a week to share stress relief, connection and coping practices.

span.a: Support and Protect Children’s Emotional Well-being

span.strong: Chimacum School District does not discriminate in any programs or activities on the basis of sex, race, creed, religion, color, national origin, honorably discharged veteran or military status, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, the presence of any sensory, mental, or physical disability, or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following employee has been designated to handle questions and complaints of alleged discrimination: Civil Rights, Title IX, and Section 504 Coordinator: Holly Patton, 360-302-5886, Holly_patton@csd49.org and/or PO Box 278, Chimacum, WA 98325.
